topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5514436c63687220d4c71500#post_5514436c63687220d4c71500
Science wise big ships don't make a lot of sense.

A scifi that did get space battle right though would have to be battlestar galactica.  What I mean by this is that huge ships were more of the equivalent of aircraft carriers cause the small fighters were incapable of ftl, but the fighters protected the big ships from attack.  Then again there's no way the big ships would stay that close to each other and potentially in each other's firing ranges.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551448a063687220d4e91d00#post_551448a063687220d4e91d00
The way I see it its Scifi.

It DOESNT make any sense. Using Black holes as energy to power your technology.

Warping to far places with a jump gate. And using teleport that takes all the cells in your body and transfer them to another location flawlessly without you missing a leg or your skin.

Out of all of that I fined Big ships make more since than anything that's there science wise. Even if they are ridiculous in retrospect themselves.

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551449ef63687215979d0200#post_551449ef63687215979d0200
Blackholes could make for very powerful weaponry.  You fire a micro blackhole at a ship it'll tear right through it no matter what.  You fire a blackhole at a planet it's completely fucked and irreversibly; you know how in the first star trek remake movie they destroyed that planet?  Yeah; it would fuck everything over.

Teleportation is possible, but the problem with it is far too much energy required.

Creating a micro wormhole and breaking down a entity's atomic structure into data and sending it through is theoretically possible.

I mean as in big ships wouldn't tactics wise make a lot of sense, cause if you had to get that close to a enemy they would tear into you.  Imagine if say for a battleship to fire it had to be within 500ft of a enemy; it would get torn up.


If there was space battles the two sides would be millions of miles away from each other and using fighters as a large scale net to protect the mother ship from attack.

Like Ender's Game; the second war the humans won because the idea of someone attacking the mothership space wars wise was so unheard of that the aliens were in outright shock that someone was targeting the mothership and didn't know how to react to someone doing that.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
